description:
Ignite Reading teaches kids to read.

Today, 67% of students and 82% of low-income students can’t read at grade level by the end of third grade. That’s when you are supposed to go from learning to read to reading to learn. It’s America’s number one education crisis and we know how to fix it.

Ignite teaches kids to read by providing 15 minutes a day of 1:1 virtual reading instruction. We focus on the reading fundamentals (letters, phonics, and sight words) kids need to master so they can decode a sentence. Our program accelerates reading progress 2.4x and we are disrupting how schools think about reading instruction.

Ignite launched our first school implementation in the fall of 2021. Sixteen months later, we will have grown our number of schools and students 35x.

Ignite Reading is a mission-driven public benefit corporation. We believe we can do well for our team members and shareholders while we solve one of the nation’s biggest challenges. We believe we will be more successful with a diverse team and are seeking candidates who have lived experience related to social justice, diversity, equity, and inclusion.

Your Role

The Vice President of Partnerships (VPP) is a key strategic leader responsible for driving revenue growth and impact. This role will play a crucial part in defining and executing sales and revenue strategies, building and managing a high-performing sales team, and fostering strong relationships with key stakeholders in our ecosystem. The VPP will report directly to the CEO and work collaboratively with other executives to achieve company objectives.

Revenue Strategy and Execution
• Develop and implement a comprehensive revenue growth strategy aligned with the company's goals and objectives.
• Develop strategic partnerships that drive sales and achieve national scale. Nurture strategic relationships with state departments of education, school districts, educational institutions, philanthropic funders, and other key stakeholders.
• Develop customer-centric initiatives that drive renewals by enhancing customer satisfaction and loyalty.
• Collaborate with the CEO to set ambitious revenue targets, monitor performance metrics, and adjust strategies to achieve and exceed revenue goals.
• Collaborate with the VP of Marketing on lead generation strategies to continue to maximize lead quality.
• Work with cross functional teams to create compelling value propositions and ensure effective product design and positioning.

Sales Leadership and Team Management
• Mentor, develop and lead a mission-driven, high-performing sales organization that consistently delivers exceptional results. Provide ongoing coaching, especially for members who enter as educators.
• Recruit, train, and retain top K-12 sales talent, fostering a culture of accountability, collaboration, and continuous improvement.
• Establish clear sales territories, quotas, and compensation plans, regularly reviewing and optimizing sales processes to maximize efficiency, productivity, and achievement of goals.

Revenue Analytics and Reporting
• Utilize data-driven insights to assess market opportunities, market trends, and competitive dynamics to inform product development.
• Track sales performance, and identify areas for improvement.
• Develop and maintain accurate sales forecasts, budgets, and financial models to support revenue planning and decision-making.
• Generate regular reports and present findings to the executive team and Ignite Reading’s Board of Directors, providing actionable recommendations to drive revenue growth.

Competencies
• Experience in an early-stage startup and ability to be a player coach who can do a sales meeting one minute and build a strategic plan for scale another minute later
• Proven track record of driving revenue growth and exceeding sales targets in the education industry.
• Extensive experience in sales leadership and team management, with a demonstrated ability to build and motivate high-performing sales teams.
• In-depth knowledge of the K-12 education market, ideally including familiarity with the literacy landscape (curriculum materials, digital solutions, and trends in early literacy instruction)
• Strong strategic thinking and problem-solving skills, with the ability to develop and execute effective sales, marketing, and revenue strategies.
• Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to build relationships with customers, stakeholders, and internal teams.
• Relationships with school districts and experience navigating the complexities of medium and large districts.
• Analytical mindset and proficiency in utilizing data and sales analytics tools to drive informed decision making.
• Experience using CRMs like Salesforce and Hubspot.
• Entrepreneurial spirit, adaptability, and results-oriented mindset.
• Willingness to travel at least 50% of the time.

We also ensure you have the tools you need to thrive both in and out of work.
• Employee Stock Options
• 401k + employer contribution
• Medical, Dental, and Vision (80% employee coverage, 50% dependent coverage)
• Short-term disability (100% employer paid)
• Technology Stipend
• Unlimited PTO + 12 paid holidays
• Professional Development Stipend
• Wellness Reimbursement
• Internet Stipend
• 12 Weeks of Parental Leave
• Yearly Staff Retreat
• Voluntary Life Insurance

At Ignite Reading, we believe in building and fostering a diverse and inclusive workplace environment. We are proud to be an equal opportunity employer where all applicants are considered for employment without attention to color, religion, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, veteran or disability status. Research shows that candidates from underrepresented backgrounds often don't apply for roles if they don't meet all the criteria – unlike majority candidates meeting significantly fewer requirements. We strongly encourage you to apply if you’re interested!

We are seeking candidates who have lived experience related to social justice, diversity, equity, and inclusion. We are a virtual organization with headquarters in the California Bay Area.
